intro: Selinum frutescens, commonly known as lesser cowplant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbrella-shaped clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks. Selinum frutescens is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
